oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Graves; Cemeteries; Tombs & sepulchral monuments
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Burial; Cemeteries -- Tennessee; Sepulchral monuments; Tombs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tombstone of Alvin C. York with brass plaque and engraved decorations. The decorations above the plaque depict York's Congressional Medal of Honor, a rifle with bayonet attached, and an M1917 "Tommy" helmet. 35mm slide labeled "York Memorial 5."

York died on September 2, 1964, and was buried in Wolf River Cemetery in Pall Mall, TN. His funeral was attended by Gov. Frank Clement and Gen. Matthew B. Ridgway, the latter attending as personal representative of President Lyndon B. Johnson. During World War II, Ridgway commanded the 82nd Division, the division in which York served during World War I.
